metadata.titel_preek: Der Baum der Erkenntnis und der Baum des Lebens

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The liberation of humanity (specifically women) from a tradition of insult and patriarchal suppression through the act of 'Coming Out' (eating from the tree of knowledge) to achieve full human identity.

subject.identificatie: Woman / Eve (as the representative of humanity)
tekstueel_bewijs: Alles Entscheidende kommt von der Frau.
Sie agiert, sie disputiert... mit der Schlange.
Sie entdeckt in ungebrochener Neugier Dinge, die das Leben verändern.
unsere Identität, unsere Wahrheit, unser Gottesverhältnis
die Freude des Lernens, das Glück des Schönen und die Erkenntnis

zender.identificatie: The Spirit of Liberation / The 'Coming Out' impulse
tekstueel_bewijs: Gegen die Beleidigungstradition steht die der Befreiung.
Coming out – herauskommen – ist ein Befreiungswort.
das Leben von jeder einzelnen Frau, die hier im Raum ist
damit wir mehr Anteil am Leben haben
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Does hearer identify with Subject or Receiver?

tekstueel_bewijs: Lasst uns Eva loben, die das zuwege gebracht hat!
helper.rol_van_god: God is initially an Opponent/Bystander, later a minor Helper (clothing them).

tegenstander.identificatie: The Patriarchal Tradition / The Jealous God
tekstueel_bewijs: Der patriarchalische Gott... hat Angst um seine Privilegien.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily a cultural/interpretative framework and a repressive parental-style deity.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The imitation of God (Imitatio Dei) through social justice (clothing the naked).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearers (We)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Once liberation (Program 1) is achieved, the subject imitates the caring aspect of God.

voorbeelden_god_subject: Gott der Herr machte Adam und seinem Weibe Röcke
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Wir sind B und nicht A
Von diesem Baum will ich essen

voorbeelden: Lasst uns tun, was Gott tut.
weiß, was gut und böse ist
Es ist möglich, auch die Nackten... zu kleiden.
Sind wir fähig... Menschen zu werden?

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is driven by human desire and motivation (Vouloir) and the acquisition of knowledge (Savoir) as the means of empowerment.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Tradition) to ~S1 (Stagnation in Eden) to S1 (Liberation through Knowledge).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by reinterpreting the 'Fall' as a necessary birth/liberation, moving from a repressive God to a companion God.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 (Judgment/Sin) is largely deconstructed as a social construct rather than a cosmic reality.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While it uses the language of 'liberation', the structure is anthropocentric. The human (Eve/Woman) is the hero of the narrative; God is either the obstacle or a secondary helper. Salvation is achieved through human curiosity and 'Coming Out'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Lasst uns Eva loben, die das zuwege gebracht hat!
Die Wörter Sünde und Fall erscheinen im biblischen Text nicht.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Gott der Herr machte Adam und seinem Weibe Röcke

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Eve is presented as the heroic archetype of the modern emancipated woman.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: A theocentric reading would focus on God's provision of the 'Lamb' or the 'Skin' despite human rebellion, or Christ as the true Tree of Life.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Empowerment and self-actualization; potential loss of the sense of need for a Savior.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Pelagian tendency: humanity saves itself through knowledge.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is coherent in its feminist-liberationist logic but clashes with traditional soteriology.
spanning_punten: The role of Christ is mentioned briefly but feels like an appendix to the human 'Coming Out' story.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Lasst uns tun, was Gott tut.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is redefined as a 'happy moment' of growth; the only real 'sin' is the patriarchal tradition.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is powered by human agency. Eve is the Subject, Knowledge is the Object, and the Patriarchal God is the Opponent.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: Humanity is the hero of its own liberation.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: God as the one who grants life and covers shame.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'Eve brought this about', use 'God allowed the path of freedom to open, even at great cost to Himself.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Hero' of the Fall.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Focus on the 'Röcke von Fellen' (God's grace) as the primary action.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that we cannot reach the Tree of Life by our own knowledge.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Recognize the 'Cherubim' and the 'Sword' as the real barrier of sin/death that only Christ can cross.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Without a real death/judgment, grace is just 'self-help'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (clothing others) is based on imitation, not response to salvation.
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: God clothes us → Therefore we can clothe others.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically powerful and liberating for a specific context, but structurally it replaces the Gospel of Grace with a Gospel of Self-Emancipation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, this is a sermon of 'empowerment'; semiotically, it is a narrative of 'self-salvation'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would struggle with the positive reading of the serpent; semiotics reveals that the serpent functions as a 'Helper' in this specific narrative world.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that 'God' and the 'Patriarchal Tradition' are fused into a single 'Opponent' actant in the first half of the sermon.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'Grace' language at the very end, but the actantial structure remains anthropocentric throughout.
